meanings.definition: Take part in a violent public disturbance.
meanings.sent1: During the protest, people started rioting in the streets.
meanings.sent2: The citizens began rioting after the controversial decision was announced.
meanings.sent3: The clowns at the circus accidentally started rioting when they all tried to fit into the tiny car.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds seemed to be rioting in the sky, clashing and rumbling.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire was rioting through the forest, consuming everything in its path.

meanings.definition: Engage in wild or disorderly behavior.
meanings.sent1: The children were rioting in the playground, running around and screaming.
meanings.sent2: After eating too much candy, the kids started rioting in the living room.
meanings.sent3: The puppies began rioting around the house, knocking over everything in their path.
meanings.sent4: The waves were rioting against the shore, crashing with great force.
meanings.sent5: The wind was rioting through the trees, causing the branches to sway wildly.
